Selected Presentations

January 2022

Bleaman, Isaac, Katie Cugno & Annie Helms. Medium shifting as a constraint on intraspeaker variation in virtual interviews. Talk presented at the LSA 2022 Annual Meeting.

October 2021

Bleaman, Isaac, Katie Cugno & Annie Helms. Increased intelligibility (but not formality) in Zoom interviews. Talk presented virtually at NWAV 49, hosted by the University of Texas at Austin.

Helms, Annie. Bidirectionality of language contact: Spanish and Catalan vowels. Poster presented virtually at the LSA 2021 Annual Meeting.

November 2020

Helms, Annie. Bay Area Spanish: Regional sound change in contact languages. Talk presented virtually at Going Romance 34, hosted by Structures Formelles du Langage.

July 2020

Helms, Annie. Sociophonetic variability in the production of Spanish /e/ by Catalan-Spanish bilinguals in Barcelona. Talk presented virtually at the 50th Linguistic Symposium on Romance Languages at the University of Texas at Austin.

October 2019

Licata, Gabriella, Annie Helms & Rachel Weiher. Merger in production and perception? Bilingual discrimination of Spanish /Î²/ and /v/. Talk presented at the Hispanic Linguistics Symposium at the University of Texas at El Paso.
